column4: SunEdison's yieldco to pay less for Vivint Solar's assets
column5: SunEdison Inc's  yieldco will now buy Vivint Solar Inc's  rooftop solar assets for a smaller amount  bowing to pressure from activist hedge fund Appaloosa Management.

column4: UPDATE 2-SunEdison's yieldco to pay less for Vivint Solar's assets
column5: * SunEdison shares rise as much as 27 pct  TerraForm 34 pct   (Details  background  updates shares)

column4: SunEdison cuts cash portion of Vivint Solar offer
column5: Dec 9 Solar company SunEdison Inc said it cut the cash portion of its offer for Vivint Solar Inc  by $2.00 to $7.89 per share.

column4: Wal-Mart's China imports cost 400 000 U.S. jobs during 2001-2013: report
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc's  import of goods from China led to the loss of over 400 000 jobs in the United States between 2001 and 2013  according to a report from a U.S.-based non-profit think tank.

column4: UPDATE 1-Wal-Mart's China imports cost 400 000 US jobs during 2001-2013 - report

column4: Wyndham settles U.S. FTC data breach charges
column5: Wyndham Worldwide Corp has agreed to settle U.S. Federal Trade Commission charges that it failed to properly safeguard customer information  in a case arising from three data breaches affecting more than 619 000 customers.

column4: Wyndham settles FTC data breach charges

column4: UPDATE 2-Wyndham settles U.S. FTC data breach charges
column5: * No fine or admission of wrongdoing   (Recasts lead; adds settlement details  comment from lawyer)

column4: FTC  Wyndham settle lawsuit over data breaches
column5: Dec 9 The Federal Trade Commission has settled a lawsuit accusing hotel group Wyndham Worldwide Corp of failing to properly safeguard customer information  in a case arising from three data breaches affecting more than 619 000 customers.

column4: Tibet to get first KFC next year  amid China expansion
column5: DALLAS KFC is expected to open its first restaurant in Tibet next year  as parent Yum Brands Inc looks to expand in the Chinese market and shake off a series of food scares and marketing blunders that have severely dented its sales in the country.
